operation_mode.label: Operation Mode
operation_mode.comment: If the test mode is selected the test account id is used. Otherwise the configured live account id is used.

customer_id.label: Live Customer ID
customer_id.comment: The live customer id can be found in the MySaferpay backend on the top right corner (without the e and the last 3 digits). For more information consult our set up manual.

terminal_id.label: Live Terminal ID
terminal_id.comment: The live terminal id can be found in the MySaferpay backend via Transactions > Payment. It consists of an eight digit number and can be found on the top left. For further information consult our set up manual. id as given by the Saferpay.

json_username.label: Live JSON Username
json_username.comment: The live JSON username can be found in the backend of MySaferpay via Administration > JSON API. For further information please consult our set up manual.

json_password.label: Live JSON API password
json_password.comment: The live JSON API password can be chosen freely in the backend of MySaferpay via Administration > JSON API. For further information please consult our set up manual.

customer_id_test.label: Test Customer ID
customer_id_test.comment: The test customer id as given by the Saferpay.

terminal_id_test.label: Test Terminal ID
terminal_id_test.comment: The test terminal id as given by the Saferpay.

json_username_test.label: Test JSON Username
json_username_test.comment: The test JSON username given by the Saferpay.

json_password_test.label: Test JSON API Password
json_password_test.comment: The test JSON API password as given by Saferpay.

merchant_email.label: Merchant email
merchant_email.comment: Saferpay will send an email to this address, whenever a payment is succesfully authorized. (Available only for payments where the customer is redirected to Saferpay.)

liability_shift.label: Liability Shift Behavior
liability_shift.comment: If no liability shift is given by a transaction, should the transaction be marked as uncertain?

order_id_schema.label: Order Prefix
order_id_schema.comment: Here you can insert an order prefix. The prefix allows you to change the order number that is transmitted to Saferpay. The prefix must contain the tag {id}. It will then be replaced by the order number (e.g. name_{id}).

payment_page_theme.label: Payment Page Theme
payment_page_theme.comment: The backend of Saferpay allows the definition of payment page configurations. This field contains the name of such a configuraiton name. The configuration allows the detailed control over the layout of the payment page.

payment_page_configuration_name.label: Payment Page Configuration Name
payment_page_configuration_name.comment: You can define the paymentpage configuration name. You can create new configuration in the backend of Saferpay. If the configuration is not found by Saferpay, the default configuration is used.

css_url.label: Payment Page CSS URL
css_url.comment: You can define here a CSS URL which is included in the payment page. The CSS can only be used, when it is hosted on a server which has SSL enabled.

description.label: Description of the order
description.comment: The order description is shown to the customer on the payment page. The desribtion should describe the products that are sold.

moto_terminal_id.label: Live MoTo Terminal ID
moto_terminal_id.comment: The live MoTO terminal id as given by the Saferpay.

moto_terminal_id_test.label: Test MoTo Terminal ID
moto_terminal_id_test.comment: The test MoTO terminal id as given by the Saferpay.

cancel_existing_orders.label: Cancel pending orders when out of stock
cancel_existing_orders.comment: If a product is in stock only once and the payment of the customer ordering this product fails or is aborted, it won't be available until the order is canceled (see timeout option below). Enable this setting to cancel the customer's pending orders when he returns to the cart page and a product is not available anymore. Be careful though: If you enable this option, there is a chance that payments are made with the corresponding order being already canceled.

cancel_pending_orders.label: Timeout for pending orders
cancel_pending_orders.comment: Define the number of seconds after which orders with a pending payment will be cancelled automatically.

wait_for_success.label: Wait On Success Page
wait_for_success.comment: In some cases the transaction requires a few seconds until it is successfully authorized. When this option is enabled the user is hold until the transaction reach the final state. If this is not the case in 30 seconds a message is shown to the customer, which explains the situation.

external_checkout_account_creation.label: External Checkout: Guest Checkout
external_checkout_account_creation.comment: When using an external checkout, the customer can either be asked to chose an option to authenticate (as guest, register or login) or he can always be checked out as guest. For the second option to work, guest checkout has to be enabled in magento.

logging_level.label: Logging Level
logging_level.comment: Messages of this or a higher level will be logged.

recurring.label: Recurring Payments
recurring.comment: If you would like to use recurring payments, you need our magento module "Customweb Subscription". For further information go to sellxed.com.
